de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.auth

Class AccountAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.accounts.AbstractAccountAuthenticator
      • de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.auth.AccountAuthenticator

  • public class AccountAuthenticator
extends AbstractAccountAuthenticator

    Implements the authentication management logic for MQTT accounts, specifically adding and updating account credentials. Token based authentication is not yet implemented, mainly due to limitations on the MQTT broker's end.

    The overridden callback methods are called through AccountManager, when the corresponding account management methods are called.

    See Also:
    AccountManager, AbstractAccountAuthenticator, AccountAuthenticatorActivity

      • addAccount

        public Bundle addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse response,
                         String accountType,
                         String authTokenType,
                         String[] requiredFeatures,
                         Bundle options)
        Initiates the process of creating an MQTT account on the device. Triggered by AccountManager.addAccount(String, String, String[], Bundle, Activity, AccountManagerCallback, Handler). The appropriate login activity of type AccountAuthenticatorActivity as well as additional extra parameters are configured through the returned intent bundle.
        Specified by:
        addAccount in class AbstractAccountAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        response - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle)
        accountType - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle)
        authTokenType - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle)
        requiredFeatures - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle)
        options - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle)
        Returns:
        Bundle containing the intent that specifies the appropriate login activity and extra parameters.
        See Also:
        AccountAuthenticatorActivity, AccountManager

      • updateCredentials

        public Bundle updateCredentials(AccountAuthenticatorResponse response,
                                Account account,
                                String authTokenType,
                                Bundle options)
        Initiates the process of updating the credentials of an MQTT account on the device. The appropriate credential modification activity of type AccountAuthenticatorActivity as well as additional extra parameters are configured through the returned intent bundle.
        Specified by:
        updateCredentials in class AbstractAccountAuthenticator
        Parameters:

        authTokenType - See AbstractAccountAuthenticator.updateCredentials(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, Account, String, Bundle)

        See Also:
